title: Still love it... but needs improvement.
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2021
content: There is an absolute love/annoyed relationship I have with this skill... Which stories are the long ones? Have a list... but no times? Why can't it do "would you like another story?" and simply say "yes" would be great. Sucks that you go all the way back out to start again. My kids would fall asleep so fast if it would just play at least 3 in a row. They literally wake up to ask to open again.  Make it more like sound machine style and it would be a solid 4 star. Make it to where we knew which one the long stories are and it could be a 5 star. We love the app and my kids listen to it nightly now. However, a few changes could make it to where we don't even need our sound machines. Also the short stories could be less short... some are really short and have to start skill all over again like every 1-2 minutes:/ Still love it, but needs much improvement.

title: To those having issues:
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2020
content: I was having trouble getting things to olay for my kids after giving permissions for a lot of apps .. I found tho that all I had to do was say to my Alexa speaker "Alexa, sync to phone to update permissions". She said "okay searching" & after that the kids were able to play. a couple times I had to do this again after giving permission.. not sure why she isnt syncong automatically with profile changes.. but maybe there was a recent update that is causing it to glitch..? im sure it will be fixed the next time around. :) hope this helps guys !

title: Fun and interactive for all ages
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2021
content: I love that this app not only starts naturally asking harder or easier questions based on performance, but also lets kids choose topics and difficulty levels in a naturally conversational way. It's also great that it gives second chances to try again rather than just saying it's wrong and moving on.Even my 3 year old was able to figure it out within the first few minutes of trying. She'll say, "Let's do counting" and then she takes turns counting with Alexa. When Alexa asks which number she wants to count by, my daughter will try by 10s or 5s or whatever, and she enjoys the challenge. Sometimes Alexa doesn't understand what my daughter says, and she'll say something like, "I didn't understand that. We're counting by 1s. What comes after 12?" and then my daughter will have another chance to answer.As a former math teacher, I love that you can choose a grade level to start with and then it provides math concepts and questions that are consistent with that grade's standards, but also differentiates higher or lower depending on performance, without telling the kids that they are now 'working in a lower grade level' or anything like that. She'll also double check with you to see if you'd like to try easier or harder problems, based on your performance, and the questions will get more difficult but stay within the same concept, rather than switching abruptly from multiplication to division or something like that.Overall, this is a solid math practice skill. Alexa understands a wide variety of inputs too which makes it easy to navigate without having to remember specific commands. I only wish that there were more moments of silliness and bigger celebrations, as my kiddo would probably get a kick out of that.

title: Spells too fast and can't get it function right
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2017
content: I taught my son how to ask Alexa to spell words, but she spells so fast he'd have to ask her to spell the word each time to get the next letter, it was annoying, but worked.This Kid Spell is much WORSE! I said "ask kid spell to spell monster", Alexa said "Ok, here's spelling alphabet, M as in Mike, O as in Oscar, N as in November, S as in Sierra, T as in Tango, E as in Echo, R as in Romeo", and she says it all at her normal fast pace, which makes it so confusing with the phonetic alphabet. Plus I tried so many times to get her to spell  the word one letter at a time, but couldn't get her to. I also tried the repeat function, but I couldn't get her to do it.  Maybe it's just me, but I've been able to figure out most of the many other skills I've enabled.

title: Son is excited to brush his teeth!
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2018
content: So, it's almost worth getting an Alexa just to utilize this skill -- it's seriously great. My husband enabled it over the weekend and our 6-year-old is EXCITED to brush his teeth now. We have a 2-minute timer, but he tends to stare at it and not engage with the actual tooth brushing. I love that this gives kids fun facts to focus on but also gives them useful tips such as switching sides, brushing each tooth, etc. And it leaves them hanging, telling them they'll learn the answer to a question, for example, when they come back to brush that night! So clever. I love that it's themed, too, so he's learning about Halloween this week. Would give six stars if I could.

content: While my kids like chompers and I like them brushing for two minutes, the program encourages participation (stomping, answering questions, etc), distracting from brushing and doesn't give proper time for brushing all sections of teeth for the same amount of time. The progress counter resets, making it pointless. And their songs are not awesome. I'd love to find a different app. I like the trivia it shares and it's fun for the most part. I just think they could do a better job.

title: Superb app, BUT
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2018
content: First the bad...1.) It is so hard for Alexa to understand the word "CHOMPERS". It is near impossible for my 6 year old son to start this skill. It has actually upset him to the point of tears after trying probably over 20 times in a row to start the skill. Sometimes it's hard for me to start it. I've tried "start Chompers", "play Chompers", "start Chompers skill", "brush my teeth with Chompers", and just any combination of words with "Chompers" to get her to understand. Choppers is just not an easy word for the age group of kids that would be using this to pronounce and you all know how frustrating Alexa can be when she never understands what you, as an adult, is saying. I wish the start word or phrase was easier to pronounce and Alexa could understand better. Also, when I inevitably have to start the skill, it takes so long to start that you think it didn't start and you keep waking Alexa and repeatedly tell her to start Chompers.2.) I wish it instructed you to brush your tongue, floss, use mouth wash and rinse your toithbrush. I'm thoroughly happy with it as it is, this would just be a huge added benefit. Hopefully it will get added.The easiest way we've found to help avoid the pronounciation/Alexa's poor comprehension is I use Alexa on my Fire tablet to start Chompers and then give it to my son to take to the bathroom to listen. When you start it on your tablet a screen pops up where I can pause it so he has enough time to get it to the bathroom and get ready to brush and he can press play whenever he's ready.The good...I cannot praise this app enough! Such a simple but genius idea. It's had to get kids to clean anything, especially for a full 2 minutes twice a day. I love brushing my teeth, but it's hard for me to do 2 minutes of it twice a day because I have Rheumatoid Arthritis and it's incredibly painful to do nothing but brush for 2 minutes only thinking about how bad it's hurting your hand. Distraction is the mother of pain relief and this fascinating, twice daily, two minute program is a fantastic distraction and a great and fun fact learning adventure for kids and adults! My son loves sharing what he learns from Chompers. LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this app for both my son and me!!!

title: Lost Progress Twice. No Response from Gimlet.
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2019
content: My daughter and I have been using Chompers for over 6 months. We “Let’s brush our teeth” every night. Back in August we were at 93 times and then it “magically” reset to 0. I have disabled the app and have encouraged others in my family to do the same.However, during those times that it did keep our progress my daughter and I did enjoy the 2 minutes. It would of been nice to hear, “Wow, you have brushed 100 times. Amazing”.

We were approaching 50 times in a row and my kid was VERY excited about it. And then the morning came we’d finally reach 50...and nothing. The counter had reset itself. It went back to zero even though we never missed a morning or night tooth brushing. Very disappointing...

title: Ok did anyone actually read the child privacy disclosure?

content: It says that they will know when your child is using the device and they will collect your child’s info such as name, birthdate, contact information (including phone numbers and e-mail addresses), voice, photos, videos, location, certain activity and device information, and certain other types of information. title: So so
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2021
content: It was difficult to pair. I followed the directions to the latter but it didn’t work. I played around with my Alexa settings and switched the Fuzzable off and on between tries. I finally got it paired. My daughter was happy. It’s really for small children. Maybe 2 or 3 because it really is mostly for the cute factor. Kids 5 and older will get board after 5 min. I figured why not, it’s cute, it’s on flash sale and I have multiple house hold items that are Alexa activated. We thought the ears would light up better too. All-in-all it’s cute and mainly for very small children. A word of advice- do not give up when it won’t pair. Try activating kids mode in your Alexa app first before you pair. Once paired you can take it off of kids mode☝🏾

title: interesting concept
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2020
content: Fuzzible Friends is an interesting concept and neat for kids. the stories are fun and interactive but i think having to wait for alexa to translate what they say may cause kids to lose interest. will have to keep playing with it to see how it improves.

title: Good potential but it Could do so much more
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2020
content: It is a great idea, but all it does is make annoying noises while Alexa "translates" the gibberish.Even though it was a pain to figure out how to connect the device and the stuffed animal, it would've been worth it if the Alexa apps worked through the fuzzible animal. So when my daughter wants Alexa to read a book to her, she could snuggle up with the Fuzzible on a cushion in the living room or in bed and listen to the book.  Or at night as she falls asleep, could listen to quiet sleeping music next to her.  Gratefully I bought it on sale so I'm not too disappointed as the stuffed animal is cute as long as the switch stays off

title: Cute Idea for the Price
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2021
content: I think like other reviewer have mentioned, you need a newer Alexa (echo in my case) for it to pair. I first tried it on our echo dot 3rd gen, and no luck, Alexa could not find...So after reading a few reviews (my daughter accidentally lost the instructions while opening other bday gifts) I tried it on my daughter's Echo dot 4 (Panda) thru the Alexa App and Bluetooth and it worked the very first time I didn't even have to press its left hand..Thank God it worked tho! Very Cute, i tried it out for a min,Our daughter is out w/gma but i think shell love it as a Alexa and Plush Lover...(she's 4) The Bunnies name is Fluffy or Fluff..Alexa translates, It plays games, Takes turns making up and story telling with child. So honestly for the sale price The Fuzzible and Its Skill is worth it to me! Thank you!

title: Fabulous, creative adventure game, with math!
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2018
content: This is a fantastic and creative choose-your-own-adventure game in which you must navigate through a variety of math challenges (rec. for ages 6-8) to ultimately save the Queen. There are plenty of non-math choices to determine the course of your adventure, meaning you'll likely never have the same adventure twice. (Really well designed!) My 4.5-year-old can't do all the math yet, but she begs to do this adventure together every evening.  Pro tip: if you need more time to solve a problem, just ask Alexa to "repeat". Otherwise, she will time out, thinking that the game has been abandoned.

title: Really enjoyed this game
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2018
content: Really enjoyed this game.  It's a combination of choose-your-own-adventure and math skills.  I played it initially on my own and then later with a 7 year old (who then wanted to play again).  The story follows you, a mathematician, as you attempt to save your queen from crafty elves.  Making decisions as you go, you find your way through a rich environment, passing mathematical barriers in an effort to rescue the queen.  Really well done, with good replay-ability thanks to the variety of paths and the randomization of the puzzles.  The story is told very well, and the sound effects are perfect (this skill makes excellent use of Alexa's voice, adding inflection and tones that I haven't heard before).  We actually turned the lights out for the second playing and the experience was even better.  Very enjoyable - I highly recommend it.

title: The Queen Knows More Than English!
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2018
content:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   My 7 year old daughter just loved this Alexa skill!  She hasn't yet been introduced to the "choose your own adventure" genre that I loved so much as a kid.  We enjoyed the mix of math, fun and storytelling which keeps my daughter both engaged and attentive.  Her only request - ducks.  Weird, I know, but that's our life.

title: Fun game that teaches math concepts through a clever, creative, and entertaining story.
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2018

title: Awesome maths game for early grade kids
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2018
content: A creative and fun game that requires the kids to solve math problems to proceed through a magical castle and save the Queen. My 7 year old son really loved the game, and the math challenges were great for this age group. He had so much fun listening to the narration and the amusing comments after answering questions correctly that I don’t think he realized he was doing math! The story is really creative and captivating for young imaginations.

title: Love this game!
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2018
content: This is the most engaging and cool thing!  There are sound effects and fun surprises wrapped into an adventure in the queen's castle, richly described. As the mathematician, the child solves simple math problems to work through the adventure. The child also chooses directions and options along the way. This has to be th most enchanting skill on Alexa!

date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2018
content: I was super excited when I saw this skill.  I am a homeschooller with 6 and 7 year old boys.  They struggle to get their daily tasks completed.  I was hoping this skill could help us all keep track.  I find a few issues.1.  You can't set up multiple children.2.  I am a very clear speaking person, but it doesn't recognize what I am saying very well.3.  Most importantly and most annoying, it shutts down after one command.  If you have asked Alexa to open the Magic door, you will understand how she can ask questions, wait for your feedback, then ask another question.  You would think that this skill would allow you to set up a task, ask how many stars, and then ask if you need to add another task or reward, etc.  But, it does not.  When I say add a task.  It asks how many stars it is worth.  When I answer, it shuts down the skill.  If I want to add another task, I must ask Alexa to open the task again.Also, the skill only gives the options to Add a Task, Add  new reward, or list tasks.  It would be helpful to make it easier to mark tasks as complete or remove tasks.  With some additional work, I started with two tasks to try it out.  I was able to remove the first task.  When I tried to remove the second task, it says it doesn't exist because it is not recognizing my voice well, and you need to pronounce it exactly the same way.  If would be easier if you could have it read the tasks, and ask if you want to mark it or skip to next.  This could be of great benefit to a busy mom like me, and my kids would feel like they have more self reliance, but not until some improvements are made.  Currently disabling.

title: Fun little skill, can get a little repetitive on the facts
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2017
content: It’s a pretty simple and easy to use skill.As Amazon expected, this is one that is child focused and appeals them. Once I saw how much mine like it, I realized why it was necessary for them to ensure that children have obtained parental permission. Since the skill requires (collecting and) parsing my child’s voice to give the desired response, it made sense they needed both approval to collect their personal data and verify I am me. I haven’t seen anything else about my child that they have asked for or collected.The location and facts were fun, even if the facts started to cycle somewhat quickly. Also, there was a bit of struggle asking the suggested “when will Santa arrive?” question.

title: Needs more instructions!
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2020
content: My children really enjoyed having this going while they cleaned but after they ended up hearing the clean up what's left instruction for about twenty minutes before they finished! I recommend adding several more instruction types to keep the little ones active and engaged! I'll include several examples below!Clean up booksClean up clothesClean up toys with flat edgesClean up things that are red (Or any color really)Clean up stuffed animalsClean up big toysClean up little toysAs a mother currently trying to use this to make cleaning fun so that my kids will start cleaning up on their own, I have plenty of ideas of how this can be improved! The concept is solid though and the kids love that they can have little challenges to get their chores done. If more options are added I will update my review. :)

skillname: The Living Calculator - Educational Math Game
title: I tried this on the easy level to test it out
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2018
content: I tried this on the easy level to test it out.  When you read the description, it sounds like it would be so easy as to be boring.  However, it isn't really the math that is the issue.  It is your ability to remember the equation as you work it out.  She reads it pretty fast.  The answers on the easy level are not under the number 10, only the numbers in the equation.  Four stars because it is fun, but if I take a second too long to give the answer, I would like a resume game function.  Also, I think you should get more time for longer equations.

skillname: Cool Koala - Bedtime Meditations for Kids
title: Great way to get children started on Meditation!
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2021
content: This skill is a great way to get kids interested in meditation, while also making it fun! The 5-minute sessions are the perfect length for little ones, and the guidance is just right for kids to follow along. Our girls love the creature voices, and can't wait each day to listen to the next one and see which friends of Cool Koala will be on board. And the Koala is really sweet and a perfect companion for a meditation journey. So far, my 4 and 6 year old have done two days of meditation and are ready for the third: The liked it so much they repeated the first day three times, and the second one two times. I'd say my 4 year-old may be a little young, but she still enjoys and benefits from the session, while my 6 year-old is a perfect age! They both have a little trouble staying still, but benefit greatly just the same.

skillname: Cool Koala - Bedtime Meditations for Kids
title: my asd adhd kid loves it
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2022
content: My 8yr old son has a hard time unwinding. Bedtime makes him anxious because he's afraid of nightmares. We stumbled on this skill a couple weeks ago.  He loves it and it seems to help.  The only problem I have now is he keeps talking about Cool Koala Plus and I can't find any information about it!

skillname: Cool Koala - Bedtime Meditations for Kids
title: Perfect!
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2022
content: My 6 year old has a hard time shutting down at night sometimes, and this short, simple meditation really helps her relax and clear her mind. I love how empowering it is as well. Highly recommed!!

skillname: Cool Koala - Bedtime Meditations for Kids
title: My girls love this - wish there was more like it !
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2022
content: My 7yo in particular has a very hard time getting settled for bed, she worries a lot and her anxiety keeps her awake. This helps a lot and I wish they were longer!

skillname: Cool Koala - Bedtime Meditations for Kids
title: What a life saver!
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2021
content: These soothing, kid-friendly meditations are amazing. When my 9-year-old son was in the hospital recently, and anxious about procedures, these meditations helped him calm down and relax in a way that nothing else could. Eternally grateful for the way these meditations enable little ones to travel mentally and reach a happy and comfortable mental state.

skillname: Cool Koala - Bedtime Meditations for Kids
title: great meditation intro
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2021
content: Helped our 6-year-old daughter to sit still for almost the whole session. This is a tough customer, the same kid who insists whe "hates yoga" based on an earlier experience in preschool. The visualizations combined with the narrator's calming voice brought us to a different place. Looking forward to future sessions, not just to relax in the moment but to develop an important life skill. This is a great way to get your kid's feet wet, without asking too much of a young kid's attention span.

skillname: Cool Koala - Bedtime Meditations for Kids
title: Making Meditation Fun!
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2021
content: My son, who has ADHD and Anxiety, loves Cool Koala!  It makes meditation fun since it has a whole host of funny characters that help teach the concepts. It's also great since it uses very creative, imaginative guided meditations that captivate my child's imagination AND attention!

skillname: Cool Koala - Bedtime Meditations for Kids
title: Charming and empowering!
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2021
content: My 7 and 9 year old simply love these meditations -- and so do my husband and I. The narrator's voice is super calming and the text itself is actually very empowering. It has become a fixed part of our evening routine. If I could give it 10 stars I would. Thank you!

skillname: Cool Koala - Bedtime Meditations for Kids
title: Soothing Male Voice
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2022
content: Ryan has a very soothing, nurturing  voice which was perfect, as my friend’s little boy related more to a male voice.

skillname: Cool Koala - Bedtime Meditations for Kids
title: Perfect for your anxious kids!
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2021
content: These are fun, relaxing and the kids just love it! Super easy to use and great for the kids to relax and you, too!

skillname: Cool Koala - Bedtime Meditations for Kids
title: Excellent app!
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2021
content: This has been so calming for my kids! So grateful for this wonderful app, which helps my children--ages 10 and 8--wind down in the evening hours. Highly recommended!

skillname: Cool Koala - Bedtime Meditations for Kids
title: Great meditation program for kids
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2021
content: Great way to introduce kids to mediation. Age-appropriate, good length, and calming and soothing but not boring. Thank you!

skillname: Cool Koala - Bedtime Meditations for Kids
title: What a great idea!
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2021
content: I learned about this skill from my nephews who got to know it in their school. What a beautiful idea! I find the koala character very cute.

skillname: Cool Koala - Bedtime Meditations for Kids
title: Magical Tool
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2022
content: We’ve added Cool Koala into our nightly routine. Change into pajamas, go to the bathroom, wash hands, brush teeth, wash face, get into bed and “Alexa, start Cool Koala.”Every night is something different, but each skill they teach is a tried and true mediation technique. They are short, so kids can manage it.I use this with our 6 and 9 year old who share a room. They have different bedtime needs. One is full of energy and wants to be silly. The other is full of anxiety and needs to relax. But they both need to calm down. And that’s what Cool Koala does.It hasn’t solved the nighttime waking issues of our 9 year old, but it has made bedtime much more manageable. He looks forward to the meditation every night and I’ve caught him using the calming techniques during the day when his anxiety explodes.

title: Perfect Story Podcast for a toddler
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2019
content: This is the best bed time podcast I have found for my 3 year old. I will tell you why.1) The meditation portion is not too long for his attention span.2) The stories are very slow and simple, great for a little toddler to follow.3) There is no "ad" portion or any kind of "tell your grown up to subscribe to this podcast" housekeeping type messaging at all in the episodes like there is in almost all the other ones we have tried. That makes SUCH a huge difference.4) The tone of voice is calm with a consistent volume and tempo. Even thought the stories have interest, they are still calm and steady for your little one falling asleep.We are so grateful for this perfect podcast :)

title: Amazing help but a little glichy!
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2020
content: The only problem really is that when the device says "if you would like to select another story say, 'Alexa, go back'" it's almost as if she hears herself and so the entire skill stops; luckily I found out that if I mute the device it works just fine! Overall, my three year old had trouble going to sleep once the tv was off but i have used this every night and he loves it! The voice is actually really calming and it encourages calm breathing to secretly help him meditate and relax completely! The sounds are the greatest part, they truly get child's interest instantly but are short enough that they fall asleep peacefully. I'd love to tell other parents about this skill, it even puts me to sleep!

title: Excellent fun app for kids to learn math tables easily
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2019
content: Love this app. Brilliant way of teaching kids math tables in a fun and interactive way.It not only teaches math tables but it immediately challenges kids with a quiz to check how well they remember what it had just taught them.I really like how the app interacts with my kid and teaches a table little by little. The scoring system, visuals on my Echo Show as well as on my amazon Fire TV are cool. Great idea.  A must have app for all kids.

title: 5 star app. An innovative way for kids to memorize math times tables
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2019
content: Wow! An innovative skill. Kudos to the Developer for coming up with such a great technique to make learning math tables fun. My kids started learning math tables very easily with this skill. Overall 5 stars. I encourage everyone to enable this free skill.

title: Bahaha 🤣 GREAT FUN & FLAWLESS
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2021
content: All in our 🏡 were amused… that is, all but 1,… our cat, MONKEY… she was NOT AMUSED.Alexa delivered a POOP rhyme appropriately, on first request (WHICH IS UNUSUAL!) so I asked for “another POOP poem”, half expecting 1 of her too-often, random AF screw ups like  ALEXA: “OK I added soup bowls to yr shopping list”-But again she Correctly 😱 offered another poopy  rhyme!  Over & over, 7-8 times we asked her for more & I now expected a repeat of a prev one, after seeing the over reactive scathing review from a ‘Karen’ who seemed INSULTED her 2nd POOP POEM echoed her 1st POOP POEM! like  maybe she felt entitled to a POOP SONNET!! 😘Anyway, after my string of all unique 💩prose … the last 1, she delivered was the classic “10 little monkeys jumpin on the bed…” rhyme and my MONKEY, smart girl that she is, raised her napping head & looked Alexa’s way, like “WHAT? I HEARD YOU… WHAT DO YOU WANT?!” then looked at each of us like “WTF?” & walked out of the room annoyed! We were all howling.So… in closing… I had way too much fun with this review but THIS SKILL WAS GREAT FUN, ALL 💩 💩 & GIGGLES…  some of these ridiculous critics of it, obviously think their 💩 doesn’t stink & need to lighten up.!Seriously?!  I mean ppl are dying 🦠in the 🌎 and some of the masses are attempting a power grab that threatens our democracy, …a place where it’s just fine if we have silly poop rhymes & it’s all good because no one GAS like y’all who are up in arms about a kids potty humor skill. Really!? GROW UP.⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
